primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human history by sending prophets to hold His favored nation accountable, ultimately moving toward a future restoration of the lowly.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will leave in the midst of you a people humble

object.identificatie: The restoration of the 'lowly' and the alignment of the nation with God's justice.
tekstueel_bewijs: I will change their shame into praise

zender.identificatie: God as the Source of Covenant and Judgment.
tekstueel_bewijs: God ordained a special providential role
I will save the lame and gather the outcast
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the 'Receiver' of the prophetic word and the 'Subject' of the secondary ethical response.

helper.identificatie: The Prophets / The Son / The Bible.
tekstueel_bewijs: He has spoken to us by a Son
the original voices of the Old Testament prophets
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; the Son is the ultimate Helper/Mediator.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the power that 'overpowers' the prophets.

tegenstander.identificatie: National Idolatry / The 'Proudly Exultant' / Rebellious House.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a structural 'rebellion' and 'idolatry' that requires divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (Subject) responds to the prophetic word by serving the poor (Object) through ministries like the homeless shelter.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation (Grace Church)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical response (Program 2) is presented as a 'gift from God' (Program 1) to keep the church from isolation.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has spoken to us by a Son
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We didn’t know about the Constitution

voorbeelden: we must examine our American consciences
desire of peoples all over the world to emigrate
We don’t know our Bibles very well
He has come in person to begin to establish that Kingdom

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's power (Pouvoir) to overpower reluctant prophets and establish His kingdom, rather than just human obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Judgment) and ~S2 (National Pride) toward S1 (The Kingdom/Restoration) through the prophetic word.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Son' and the future 'Day of the Lord' where God restores the fortunes of the humble.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the preacher explicitly uses the term 'national disgrace' and 'rebellious house'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains strong ethical calls, the underlying engine is theocentric. God is the one who 'dragoons' prophets and 'establishes' the kingdom. Human action is a 'gift' or 'blessing' from God.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Actor in Prophecy
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: they were overpowered by God’s purposes, against their natural inclinations
our shelter is a gift to us from God to keep us from being isolated

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Prophets are not presented as heroes to imitate, but as reluctant victims of God's call.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God uses the reluctant.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'self-styled' prophecy; comfort in God's ultimate restoration.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic view of the prophetic call.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from national judgment to the person of Jesus and the future kingdom is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between love for America and the 'national disgrace' of poverty.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has come in person to begin to establish that Kingdom

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (implied) gives the 'Pouvoir' to the reluctant Subject.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearers might identify with the 'rebellious house' too abstractly.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Explicitly link the hearer's own spiritual poverty to the 'lowly' God saves.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir in the middle section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that God gives the 'will' to serve the poor, not just the 'duty'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining theocentricity while addressing political and ethical realities.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'patriotism' tropes; Greimas reveals that God is the one driving the prophets against their will.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew context; Greimas shows how the 'Prophetic Role' functions as a Helper to God's Subjectivity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'reluctance' of the prophets is a key modal competence (lack of Vouloir) that proves God is the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Be like the prophets' trap by emphasizing their reluctance.
